lexUnit.name: scarce.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a resource) insufficient for the demand

sentence.text: When food is plentiful , sufficient insulin is secreted for all organs to satisfy their needs , but when food is scarce , some organs or tissues are starved .
Because food resources are scarce in the depths , animals are correspondingly thin on the ground .
Food was so scarce in Derbyshire that the apprentices had to raid dustbins .
When food was short , clothing scarce , blocks overcrowded and underheated , and war news bad , there were always books .
According to the authorized version in the Christian Brothers ' geography books of the sixties , Irish mineral resources were meagre and scarce .
Data are extremely scarce , but Heath ( 1981 ) gives evidence to show how far women are disadvantaged by their limited opportunities in the labour market .
Labour and financial resources being scarce , and social status being desirable , there is bound to be competition between different occupational groups .
Relatively few have survived from antiquity , since silver became scarce and a much sought after commodity in the late Empire .

But working class women fiercely defended their right to a room which expressed their pride in housewifery and which also afforded additional privacy , a scarce commodity in working class households .
In areas where the site is likely to be too dry , there is often more of a problem , since water for moistening the site is generally scarce in such areas .
Yet in this period , at least in Europe , the old-fashioned rural insurrection for church and king against the godless and liberal cities became scarce .
Ancient history is scarce around these parts , and you take it where you can get it -- even from people you wiped out in more recent times .
I had just asked butterfly ecologist Marney Hall whether , since butterflies are getting scarce in this country , a garden like this would really work .
Jobs are scarce at the moment , so you 've got to be realistic . "
In the harsh terrain of north-eastern Sudan , the Rashida and the Beja nomads compete for scarce resources .
If staff are the most valuable resource then time is the most scarce .

The necessary expertise is scarce in the controlling agencies such as the sponsoring ministry and state auditing bodies , and studies suggest that enterprises attempt to control access to their own expertise .
Mistletoe is very scarce and dear this year , and I can offer you seven pounds for it . "
While market research in Poland is scarce , International Data Corp estimates that the total information technology market there is worth approximately $200m a year .
Wood is scarce in the Sinai desert , but the acacia is one of the few trees which grow there .
